org.iotivity.base

Class OcPlatform

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.iotivity.base.OcPlatform

  • public final class OcPlatform
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the main entrance/functionality of the product. To set a custom configuration, the implementer must make a call to OcPlatform.Configure before the first usage of a method in this class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  OcPlatform.EntityHandler
      An EntityHandler can be registered via the OcPlatform.registerResource call.
      static interface  OcPlatform.OnDeviceFoundListener
      An OnDeviceFoundListener can be registered via the OcPlatform.getDeviceInfo call.
      static interface  OcPlatform.OnPlatformFoundListener
      An OnPlatformFoundListener can be registered via the OcPlatform.getPlatformInfo call.
      static interface  OcPlatform.OnPresenceListener
      An OnPresenceListener can be registered via the OcPlatform.subscribePresence call.
      static interface  OcPlatform.OnResourceFoundListener
      An OnResourceFoundListener can be registered via the OcPlatform.findResource call.
      static interface  OcPlatform.OnResourcesFoundListener
      An OnResourcesFoundListener can be registered via the OcPlatform.findResources call.

    • Method Detail

      • Configure

        public static void Configure(PlatformConfig platformConfig)
        API for setting the configuration of the OcPlatform.

        Note: Any calls made to this AFTER the first call to OcPlatform.Configure will have no affect

        Parameters:
        platformConfig - platform configuration

      • Shutdown

        public static void Shutdown()
        API for stop all process of the OcPlatform. All of threads and memory will be terminated by this API. Iotivity Core can be started again through Configure(PlatformConfig platformConfig) API. Both Configure and Shutdown API is filtering for duplicated calling even while processing.

        Note: This API is for both server and client side.

      • findResource

        public static void findResource(java.lang.String host,
                                java.lang.String resourceUri,
                                java.util.EnumSet<OcConnectivityType> connectivityTypeSet,
                                OcPlatform.OnResourceFoundListener onResourceFoundListener)
                         throws OcException
        API for Service and Resource Discovery

        Note: This API is for client side only.

        Note: To get the tcpPort information, user must call getAllHosts() from the OCResource object in the onResourceFound callback. To use a TCP endpoint that has been received by getAllHosts(), user must use the setHost() method.

        Parameters:
        host - Host Address of a service to direct resource discovery query. If empty, performs multicast resource discovery query
        resourceUri - name of the resource. If null or empty, performs search for all resource names
        connectivityTypeSet - Set of types of connectivity. Example: IP
        onResourceFoundListener - Handles events, success states and failure states.
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure

      • findResource

        public static void findResource(java.lang.String host,
                                java.lang.String resourceUri,
                                java.util.EnumSet<OcConnectivityType> connectivityTypeSet,
                                OcPlatform.OnResourceFoundListener onResourceFoundListener,
                                QualityOfService qualityOfService)
                         throws OcException
        API for Service and Resource Discovery.

        Note: This API is for client side only.

        Parameters:
        host - Host IP Address of a service to direct resource discovery query. If empty, performs multicast resource discovery query
        resourceUri - name of the resource. If null or empty, performs search for all resource names
        connectivityTypeSet - Set of types of connectivity. Example: IP
        onResourceFoundListener - Handles events, success states and failure states.
        qualityOfService - the quality of communication
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure

      • registerResource

        public static OcResourceHandle registerResource(OcResource ocResource)
                                         throws OcException
        This API registers a resource with the server

        Note: This API applies to server and client side.

        Parameters:
        ocResource - The instance of OcResource with all data filled
        Returns:
        resource handle
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure

      • registerResource

        public static OcResourceHandle registerResource(java.lang.String resourceUri,
                                                java.lang.String resourceTypeName,
                                                java.lang.String resourceInterface,
                                                OcPlatform.EntityHandler entityHandler,
                                                java.util.EnumSet<ResourceProperty> resourcePropertySet)
                                         throws OcException
        This API registers a resource with the server NOTE: This API applies to server side only.

        Note: This API applies to server side only.

        Parameters:
        resourceUri - The URI of the resource. Example: "a/light"
        resourceTypeName - The resource type. Example: "light"
        resourceInterface - The resource interface (whether it is collection etc).
        entityHandler - entity handler.
        resourcePropertySet - indicates the property of the resource
        Returns:
        resource handle
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure

      • startPresence

      • subscribePresence

        public static OcPresenceHandle subscribePresence(java.lang.String host,
                                                 java.util.EnumSet<OcConnectivityType> connectivityTypeSet,
                                                 OcPlatform.OnPresenceListener onPresenceListener)
                                          throws OcException
        Subscribes to a server's presence change events. By making this subscription, every time a server adds/removes/alters a resource, starts or is intentionally stopped
        Parameters:
        host - The IP address/addressable name of the server to subscribe to
        connectivityTypeSet - Set of types of connectivity. Example: IP
        onPresenceListener - listener that will receive notifications/subscription events
        Returns:
        a handle object that can be used to identify this subscription request. It can be used to unsubscribe from these events in the future
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure

      • subscribePresence

        public static OcPresenceHandle subscribePresence(java.lang.String host,
                                                 java.lang.String resourceType,
                                                 java.util.EnumSet<OcConnectivityType> connectivityTypeSet,
                                                 OcPlatform.OnPresenceListener onPresenceListener)
                                          throws OcException
        Subscribes to a server's presence change events. By making this subscription, every time a server adds/removes/alters a resource, starts or is intentionally stopped
        Parameters:
        host - The IP address/addressable name of the server to subscribe to
        resourceType - a resource type specified as a filter for subscription events.
        connectivityTypeSet - Set of types of connectivity. Example: IP
        onPresenceListener - listener that will receive notifications/subscription events
        Returns:
        a handle object that can be used to identify this subscription request. It can be used to unsubscribe from these events in the future
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure

      • unsubscribePresence

        public static void unsubscribePresence(OcPresenceHandle ocPresenceHandle)
                                throws OcException
        Unsubscribes from a previously subscribed server's presence events. Note that you may for a short time still receive events from the server since it may take time for the unsubscribe to take effect.
        Parameters:
        ocPresenceHandle - the handle object provided by the subscribePresence call that identifies this subscription
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure

      • subscribeDevicePresence

        public static OcPresenceHandle subscribeDevicePresence(java.lang.String host,
                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> di,
                                                       java.util.EnumSet<OcConnectivityType> connectivityTypeSet,
                                                       OcResource.OnObserveListener onObserveListener)
                                                throws OcException
        Subscribes to a server's device presence change events.
        Parameters:
        host - The IP address/addressable name of the server to subscribe to.
        di - Vector which can have the devices id.
        connectivityTypeSet - Set of connectivity types, e.g. IP.
        onObserveListener - The handler method will be invoked with a map of attribute name and values.
        Returns:
        a handle object that can be used to identify this subscription request. It can be used to unsubscribe from these events in the future.
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure.

      • constructResourceObject

        public static OcResource constructResourceObject(java.lang.String host,
                                                 java.lang.String uri,
                                                 java.util.EnumSet<OcConnectivityType> connectivityTypeSet,
                                                 boolean isObservable,
                                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> resourceTypeList,
                                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> interfaceList)
                                          throws OcException
        Creates a resource proxy object so that get/put/observe functionality can be used without discovering the object in advance. Note that the consumer of this method needs to provide all of the details required to correctly contact and observe the object. If the consumer lacks any of this information, they should discover the resource object normally. Additionally, you can only create this object if OcPlatform was initialized to be a Client or Client/Server.
        Parameters:
        host - a string containing a resolvable host address of the server holding the resource. Currently this should be in the format of coap://address:port for IPv4 and in the format of coap://[address%25ZoneID]:port for IPv6. In the future, we expect "coap:" section is removed from this format.
        uri - the rest of the resource's URI that will permit messages to be properly routed. Example: /a/light
        connectivityTypeSet - Set of types of connectivity. Example: IP
        isObservable - a boolean containing whether the resource supports observation
        resourceTypeList - a collection of resource types implemented by the resource
        interfaceList - a collection of interfaces that the resource supports/implements
        Returns:
        new resource object
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure

      • sendResponse

        public static void sendResponse(OcResourceResponse ocResourceResponse)
                         throws OcException
        Allows application entity handler to send response to an incoming request.
        Parameters:
        ocResourceResponse - resource response
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure

      • notifyNewAMAvailable

        public static void notifyNewAMAvailable(OcResourceHandle resourceHandle)
                                 throws OcException
        This function notifies the atomic measurement that a new atomic measurement is available (because one or more of the values of the resources composing it have changed).
        Parameters:
        handle - Handle of resource.
        Throws:
        OcException

      • constructAccountManagerObject

        public static OcAccountManager constructAccountManagerObject(java.lang.String host,
                                                             java.util.EnumSet<OcConnectivityType> connectivityTypeSet)
                                                      throws OcException
        Create an account manager object that can be used for doing request to account server. You can only create this object if OCPlatform was initialized to be a Client or Client/Server. Otherwise, this will return an empty shared ptr. Note: For now, OCPlatform SHOULD be initialized to be a Client/Server(Both) for the methods of this object to work since device id is not generated on Client mode.
        Parameters:
        host - Host IP Address of a account server.
        connectivityTypeSet - Set of types of connectivity. Example: CT_ADAPTER_IP
        Returns:
        new AccountManager object
        Throws:
        OcException - if failure
